name: CameraOptionsType
doc:
@platform android 0.8 @platform blackberry 3.1.2 @platform iphone 0.8 @platform ipad 0.8 @platform mobileweb 1.8 @pseudo @editurl https://github.com/appcelerator/titanium_mobile/edit/master/apidoc/Titanium/Media/Media.yml

Simple object for specifying options to showCamera.

property.name: allowEditing
property.doc:
Specifies if the media should be editable after capture/selection.

@platform iphone 0.8 @platform ipad 0.8
property.shortDoc: Specifies if the media should be editable after capture/selection. ...

property.name: animated
property.doc:
Specifies if the dialog should be animated upon showing and hiding.

@platform iphone 0.8 @platform ipad 0.8
property.shortDoc: Specifies if the dialog should be animated upon showing and hiding. ...

property.name: arrowDirection
property.doc:
Controls the type of arrow and position of the popover.

@description

This property is only used if the camera is displayed in a popover (inPopOver is true).

This API can be assigned the following constants:

  • Titanium.UI.iPad.POPOVER_ARROW_DIRECTION_ANY
  • Titanium.UI.iPad.POPOVER_ARROW_DIRECTION_DOWN
  • Titanium.UI.iPad.POPOVER_ARROW_DIRECTION_LEFT
  • Titanium.UI.iPad.POPOVER_ARROW_DIRECTION_RIGHT
  • Titanium.UI.iPad.POPOVER_ARROW_DIRECTION_UNKNOWN
  • Titanium.UI.iPad.POPOVER_ARROW_DIRECTION_UP

@platform ipad 0.8
property.shortDoc: Controls the type of arrow and position of the popover. ...

property.name: autohide
property.doc:
Specifies if the camera should be hidden automatically after the media capture is completed.

@description

On Android, this property is considered only if overlay is also set. When an overlay is not set, the default Android Camera Activity is used, which is only capable of reporting back the results of one taken photo, making autohide meaningless in that context.

@platform android 3.2.0 @platform iphone 0.8 @platform ipad 0.8
property.shortDoc: Specifies if the camera should be hidden automatically after the media capture is completed. ...

property.name: autorotate
property.doc:
Determines if the camera preview should rotate or not.

@description

Set to false to disable rotating the camera preview. The camera preview will remain in the same orientation it was opened in.

Set to true to allow the camera preview to rotate when the device rotates. Black bars will appear and disappear as the device is rotated.

@platform ipad 3.4.0
property.shortDoc: Determines if the camera preview should rotate or not. ...

property.name: cancel
property.doc: Function to call if the user presses the cancel button.

property.name: error
property.doc: Function to call upon receiving an error.

property.name: inPopOver
property.doc:
Show the camera in a popover.

@description

Use inPopOver: true on iPad to display the camera view in a popover.

@platform ipad 0.8
property.shortDoc: Show the camera in a popover. ...

property.name: mediaTypes
property.doc:
Array of media type constants to allow.

This API can be assigned the following constants:

  • Titanium.Media.MEDIA_TYPE_PHOTO
  • Titanium.Media.MEDIA_TYPE_VIDEO

@platform iphone 0.8 @platform ipad 0.8
property.shortDoc: Array of media type constants to allow. ...

property.name: overlay
property.doc:
View to added as an overlay to the camera UI (on top).

@description

On iOS, the overlay view is usually used in conjunction with showControls: false. The transform property can be used to scale and position the camera preview inside the overlay view.
property.shortDoc: View to added as an overlay to the camera UI (on top). ...

property.name: popoverView
property.doc:
View to position the camera or photo gallery popover on top of.

@description

This property is only used if the camera is displayed in a popover (inPopOver is true).

@platform ipad 0.8
property.shortDoc: View to position the camera or photo gallery popover on top of. ...

property.name: saveToPhotoGallery
property.doc: Specifies if the media should be saved to the photo gallery upon successful capture.

property.name: showControls
property.doc:
Indicates if the built-in camera controls should be displayed.

@platform iphone 0.8 @platform ipad 0.8
property.shortDoc: Indicates if the built-in camera controls should be displayed. ...

property.name: success
property.doc: Function to call when the camera is closed after a successful capture/selection.

property.name: transform
property.doc:
Transformation matrix to apply to the camera or photogallery view.

@description

Can be used to size and position the camera or photogallery view behind an overlay view.

@platform iphone 0.8 @platform ipad 0.8
property.shortDoc: Transformation matrix to apply to the camera or photogallery view. ...

property.name: videoMaximumDuration
property.doc:
Maximum duration (in milliseconds) to allow video capture before completing.

@platform iphone 0.8 @platform ipad 0.8
property.shortDoc: Maximum duration (in milliseconds) to allow video capture before completing. ...

property.name: videoQuality
property.doc:
Constant to indicate the video quality during capture.

@platform iphone 0.8 @platform ipad 0.8
property.shortDoc: Constant to indicate the video quality during capture. ...
